oracle.spatial.hadoop.rasterapi.core.beans

Class MosaicConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.hadoop.rasterapi.core.beans.MosaicConfiguration

  • public class MosaicConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the configuration for the mosaic output, includes the resolution, format, datatype, coordinates , required processing and every single feature of the expected mosaic output.

      Class constructor.

        public void setSrid(java.lang.String srid)
        Sets the SRID for this mosaic request.
        Parameters:

        public java.lang.String getSrid()

        the SRID value for this mosaic request.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width for this mosaic request.
        Parameters:
        width - the value to set in this mosaic's width.

      • setExecuteMosaic

        public void setExecuteMosaic(boolean executeMosaic)
        Sets value to indicate if mosaic operation will be process or not, is is true by default
        Parameters:
        executeMosaic - true if mosaic operation will be processed, false otherwise

      • isExecuteMosaic

        public boolean isExecuteMosaic()
        Gets value to indicate if mosaic operation will be process or not, is is true by default
        Returns:
        true if mosaic operation will be processed, false otherwise

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width value for this mosaic request.
        Returns:
        the width value for this mosaic request.

        Sets the height for this mosaic request.
        Parameters:

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height value for this mosaic request.
        Returns:
        the height value for this mosaic request.

      • setUpperLeftX

        public void setUpperLeftX(double upperLeftX)
        Sets the upper left point in X for this mosaic request.
        Parameters:
        upperLeftX - the value to set in this mosaic's upper left X point.

      • setUpperLeftY

        public void setUpperLeftY(double upperLeftY)
        Sets the upper left point in Y for this mosaic request
        Parameters:
        upperLeftY - the value to set in this mosaic´s upper left Y point.

      • setOrder

        public void setOrder(java.lang.String order)
        Sets the order for the pieces in this mosaic request. Ascendant or Descendant, use RasterProcessorJob.ASC or RasterProcessorJob.DESC.
        Parameters:
        order - the order for this mosaic request.

      • getOrder

        public java.lang.String getOrder()
        Gets the order for the pieces in this mosaic request.
        Returns:
        the numeric value for the order of this request.

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(java.lang.String format)
        Sets the format of the resulting image, like GTIFF, JPEG, PNG, etc. Valid for all GDAL wrie supported formats.
        Parameters:
        format - the value for the mosaic's output format.

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat()
        Gets the format of the resulting image, like tiff, geotiff.
        Returns:
        the format the value for the mosaic's output format.

      • setNoData

        public void setNoData(java.lang.String noData)
        Sets the color for the NODATA values in the output. It must start with "#" followed by the two characters representing a color, these must be set per band. For example, for a 3 band image: #FFFFFF.
        Parameters:
        noData - the NODATA value for the output's pixels. A couple of values per band is requested.

      • getNoData

        public java.lang.String getNoData()
        Gets the NODATA color values for this mosaic.
        Returns:
        the NODATA value for the output's pixels.

      • setPixelType

        public void setPixelType(java.lang.String pixelType)
        Sets the pixel type allowed for this mosaic and supported by gdal. Any other pixel type images are discarded from the output. A value such as gdalconst.GDT_Byte, gdalconst.GDT_Int16, ...
        Parameters:
        pixelType - the pixel type allowed in the ouput.
        See Also:
        gdalconstConstants class from GDT_Byte to GDT_CFloat64.

      • getPixelType

        public java.lang.String getPixelType()
        Gets the pixel type allowed for this mosaic's output.
        Returns:
        the pixel type for this mosaic request.

      • getPixelXWidth

        public double getPixelXWidth()
        Gets the width for pixel values in X in this request.
        Returns:
        the width for pixel values in X.

      • getPixelYWidth

        public double getPixelYWidth()
        Gets the width for pixel values in Y in this request.
        Returns:
        the width for pixel values in Y.

      • setPixelXWidth

        public void setPixelXWidth(double pixelXWidth)
        Sets the width for pixel values in X in this request.
        Parameters:
        pixelXWidth - the width for pixel values in X in this request.

      • setPixelYWidth

        public void setPixelYWidth(double pixelYWidth)
        Sets the width for pixel values in Y in this request.
        Parameters:
        pixelYWidth - the width for pixel values in Y in this request.

      • setDirectory

        public void setDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
        Sets the directory where the mosaic's ouput will be stored, it can be in NFS for regular FileSystem or in HDFS for Hadoop storage, depending on the setting for mosaics FileSystem.
        Parameters:
        directory - the String specifying Filesystem for the mosaic's output FS or HDFS.

      • getDirectory

        public java.lang.String getDirectory()
        Gets the output Filesystem for this request.
        Returns:
        FS for regular Filesystem or HDFS for Hadoop storage.

      • setTemporaryFolder

        public void setTemporaryFolder(java.lang.String temporaryFolder)
        Sets the temporary folder used when HDFS output is requested to store partial FS output before calling image loader job.
        Parameters:
        temporaryFolder - the temporary output folder for HDFS output

      • getTemporaryFolder

        public java.lang.String getTemporaryFolder()
        Gets the temporary output folder where partial output is stored when HDFS output is requested
        Returns:
        the temporary output folder for HDFS output

      • setDeleteLocalFile

        public void setDeleteLocalFile(boolean deleteLocalFile)
        Sets the flag that indicates if the temporary output file will be deleted or not after is loaded in HDFS
        Parameters:
        deleteLocalFile - defaults to true, indicates if local output file will be deleted or not

      • isDeleteLocalFile

        public boolean isDeleteLocalFile()
        Gets the flag that indicates if the temporary output file will be deleted or not after is loaded in HDFS
        Returns:
        the flag that indicates if local output file will be deleted or not, defaults to true

      • setBands

        public void setBands(int bands)
        Sets the number of bands for this mosaic request
        Parameters:
        bands - number of bands requested for this mosaic operation

      • setLayers

        public void setLayers(java.lang.String layers)
        Sets the order of appearance of bands in output, if the list contains more bands that the ones configured for output, the rest are ignored.
        Parameters:
        layers - bands order of appearance

      • getLayers

        public java.lang.String getLayers()
        Get the order of appearance of bands in output
        Returns:
        layers bands order of appearance

      • setProcessingClasses

        public void setProcessingClasses(java.lang.String processingClasses)
        Sets the processing classes for the related input. Container jar file must be added to job configuration using RasterProcessorJob setUserProcessingJar method.
        Parameters:
        processingClasses - the String detailing the processing classes for the related input. Processing classes are executed before the mosaic operation. Comma separated list.

      • setReduceProcessingClasses

        public void setReduceProcessingClasses(java.lang.String reduceProcessingClasses)
        Sets the reducer processing classes for the related input. Container jar file must be added to job configuration using RasterProcessorJob setUserProcessingJar method.
        Parameters:
        reduceProcessingClasses - the String detailing the reducer processing classes for the related input. Reducer processing classes are executed before the mosaic operation. Comma separated list.

      • getReduceProcessingClasses

        public java.lang.String getReduceProcessingClasses()
        Gets the reducer processing classes for the related input.
        Returns:
        the String detailing the reducer processing classes for the related input.

      • addProcessingClass

        public void addProcessingClass(java.lang.String processingClass)
        Adds a processing class to this mosaic request
        Parameters:
        processingClass - class to add in this mosaic request, this class will be executed in the processing framework.

      • addReduceProcessingClass

        public void addReduceProcessingClass(java.lang.String reduceProcessingClass)
        Adds a reduce processing class to this mosaic request
        Parameters:
        reduceProcessingClass - class to add in this mosaic request, this class will be executed in the processing framework during reduce phase.

      • getProcessingClasses

        public java.lang.String getProcessingClasses()
        Gets the processing classes for the related input.
        Returns:
        the processing classes for this request.

      • setFileSystem

        public void setFileSystem(java.lang.String fileSystem)
        Sets the Filesystem where mosaic will be stored
        Parameters:
        fileSystem - can be RasterProcessorjob.HDFS or RasterProcessorJob.FS depending on where the mosaic output is expected to be stored.

      • getFileSystem

        public java.lang.String getFileSystem()
        Gets the Filesystem where mosaic will be stored. Can be RasterProcessorjob.HDFS or RasterProcessorJob.FS
        Returns:
        fileSystem can be HDFS or FS depending on where the mosaic output is expected to be stored.

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
        Sets the file name fot tue ouput mosaic
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the output mosaic file

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()
        Gets the file name fot tue ouput mosaic
        Returns:
        fileName the name of the output mosaic file

      • setOrderAlgorithm

        public void setOrderAlgorithm(java.lang.String orderAlgorithm)
        Sets the ordering algorithm for the images in this request. ProcessConstants.ALGORITHM_FILE_LENGTH, ProcessConstants.ALGORITHM_MODIFIED_DATE or ProcessConstants.ALGORITHM_RESOLUTION
        Parameters:
        orderAlgorithm - Ordering algorithm to be considered in this mosaic request.

      • getOrderAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String getOrderAlgorithm()
        Gets the the ordering algorithm for the images in this request. ProcessConstants.ALGORITHM_FILE_LENGTH, ProcessConstants.ALGORITHM_MODIFIED_DATE or ProcessConstants.ALGORITHM_RESOLUTION
        Returns:
        the ordering algorithm to be considered in this mosaic request.

      • getCompactMosaic

        public java.lang.String getCompactMosaic()
        Gets a String representing this mosaic request configuration, used to set it to Job configuration.
        Returns:
        String with mosaic´s request data. The String has the following structure: SRID|temporaryoutputfolder|outputdirectory|filename|format|width|height|nodatavalue|order pixelType|pixelXWidth|pixelYWidth|upperLeftX|upperLeftY|bands|orderAlgorithm|processingClasses.
